net.joala.condition.timing
Class DeceleratingWait

java.lang.Object
  net.joala.condition.timing.DeceleratingWait
All Implemented Interfaces:
Wait
public class DeceleratingWait
extends Object
implements Wait

A waiter that uses the exponential backoff approach when waiting for a condition. Starting with a minimum wait period, the algorithm waits successively longer on subsequent attempts, increasing the wait time by a small percentage. This allows short waits to be completed quickly while reducing the overhead for repeated checks during long waits.

The expected number of checks grows logarithmically with the wait duration, while the wait duration remains within a constant factor of the actual time until the condition holds true.

until

public final <F,T> T until(@Nonnull
                           F input,
                           @Nonnull
                           Function<? super F,T> stateQuery)
Description copied from interface: Wait

Wait until the given input passes its state query without ignorable exception.

This call is equal to: 

until(null, input, stateQuery, null)

Specified by:
until in interface Wait
Type Parameters:
F - the input type
T - the return type of the state query
Parameters:
input - the input to pass to the query function; if implementing SelfDescribing the description of input will be queried on failure
stateQuery - the function to query the state of input; if implementing SelfDescribing the description of stateQuery will be queried on failure
Returns:
the result of the successful state query
See Also:
IgnorableStateQueryException

Wait until an expectation is met. Validate the expectation with decelerating polling intervals.
